metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3351 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: openvas-scanner before 2011-09-11 creates a temporary file insecurely when generating OVAL system characteristics document with the ovaldi integrated tool enabled. A local attacker could use this flaw to conduct symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files on the system.

notes.Note: tyhicks> Several mitigating factors here: Yama's symlink protection (10.10 and newer), requires non-standard configuration, and a openvas plugin that is not available in the archive

criterions.comment: openvas-server: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
